ACCOUNTANT
Executive Profile
Capable Accountant successful at managing multiple projects and consistently meeting deadlines under pressure.
Extensive knowledge of accounting software and processes.
Team-oriented who prepares clear, comprehensive financial reports for executive-level management.
Dynamic and highly qualified with extensive knowledge of accounting principles.
Professional Value Offered
Researched and resolved billing problems that had been previously missed.
Operated computers programmed with accounting software to record, store, and analyze information.
Maintained accurate accounts including cash inventory, prepaid, fixed assets, accounts payable, accrued expenses and line of credit transactions.
Knowledge of double-entry accounting method and cash-basis accounting method.

SKILLS

Analytical reasoning Budget forecasting expertise Account reconciliation expert Financial planner
Effective time management Advanced computer proficiency (PC and Mac) Strong organizational skills Excellent managerial techniques

WORK EXPERIENCE


04/2017 to Current
Accountant
Company Name
— City , State
Performed debit, credit and total accounts on computer spreadsheets/databases, using specialized accounting software.
Performed field audits on wide variety of clientele using Quick Books System.
Received, recorded, and banked cash, checks, and vouchers as well as reconciled records of bank transactions.
Completed monthly, quarterly and annual bank reconciliations for more than two dozen companies.
Managed accounting operations, accounting close, account reporting and reconciliations.
Aligned all financial activity with the regulations of the GAAP.

Tracked all capital spending against approved capital requests.

Increased efficiency and alleviated work loads by creating a new Excel financial recording system.
Entered weekly sales and customer count sheets for review by management.
Processed payroll, electronic deposits and employee pay adjustments.
Researched and resolved collections and billing disputes with tact and efficiency.

Controller Assistant
Company Name

Maintained compliance with company and legal requirements.
Completed quarterly and yearly audits.
Systematically prepared documents and assembled financial statements for independent auditors.
Executed accounts receivable reporting enhancements and reconciliation procedures.
Investigated and resolved discrepancies in monthly bank accounts while under tight deadlines.
Collaborated extensively with auditors during preliminary and year-end audit processes.

Controller
Company Name
— City , State
Restructured and analyzed Profit Software System to improve budget reporting.
Thoroughly reviewed financial statements and tax audits to correct any discrepancies.
Revised and streamlined inefficient work procedures with automation software.
Educated management on strategies for minimizing tax liability.
Reviewed all tax returns prepared by individual departments before approval.
Supplied detailed tax documentation needed to submit accurate corporate returns.
Reviewed program needs and recruited qualified staff.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Staff Accountant

Location: Columbia, MD

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Embark on a mission with Advanced Programs, Inc., (API) – where innovation meets impact! Join us as we revolutionize national security, responding swiftly to customer needs, and forging ahead with cutting-edge solutions. At API, we don't just meet expectations; we exceed them, creating a legacy of success in the ever-evolving landscape of intelligence, defense, and foreign affairs. This is your chance to be part of something extraordinary!We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Staff Accountant to join our team! This person will work on-site with the possibility for a hybrid schedule in the future.
Responsibilities:Maintain a computerized financial reporting system and compile financial data.Process invoices in a timely manner and investigate non-payments or invoice problems.Determine customer credit status and follow up with customers for collection.Perform bank deposits, apply cash into A/R system, and reconcile A/R balance to General Ledger.Participate in posting, balancing, analysis, and reconciliation of the general ledger and subsidiary accounts.Assist in preparation of forecasts and annual budgets.Compile financial data for income tax requirements.Assist outside auditors at year-end by preparing schedules and providing necessary data.Manage aging Accounts Receivable (A/R) reports to ensure timely collection of outstanding invoices.Utilize Department of State web portals proficiently for invoice submission and processing.Communicate effectively with Department of State representatives to resolve any issues or discrepancies related to invoice submissions.Provide exceptional customer service to internal and external stakeholders regarding billing inquiries and concerns.Build and maintain positive relationships with clients and vendors through effective communication and problem-solving.
Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance strongly preferred.2+ years of related experience preferred.Experience with NetSuite strongly preferred.Working knowledge of accounting principles and practices.Strong organizational skills.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Proficiency in MS Office Suite, particularly Excel.Ability to work independently and as part of a team.U.S. Citizenship is required for all roles.
Physical Demands:While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, use hands, reach with hands and arms, and talk or hear.Occasionally required to stand, walk, and lift/move up to 10 pounds.

Job Type: Full-timePay: From $55,000.00 per year

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
